MultipleChoice.Title: Present Simple with adverbs of frequency
MultipleChoice.Instruction: Click on the correct words so that the second sentence means the same as the first sentence.

ReferenceObject.Paragraph: 1. I always wear smart clothes to work. = I wear smart clothes to work ...
2. It never rains in the Sahara Desert. = There's ... rain in the Sahara Desert.
3. My father usually smokes in the evening. = My father smokes ...
4. I never remember to close all the windows. = There are windows open ...
5. Some people hardly ever use a cashpoint. = Some people use a cashpoint ...
6. Our teacher often comes to the class late. = Our teacher comes late ...

Choices.Choice: two or three times a week

ReferenceObject.Paragraph: 7. I usually eat fruit for breakfast. = I eat fruit for breakfast ...

Choices.Choice: four or five days a week

ReferenceObject.Paragraph: 8. Sam always goes to gym after work. = Sam goes to the gym ...
